qas.question: An interest in texts from which two ancient civilizations sparked the Italian Renaissance?
Which conflicts brought Europeans into contact with Arabs prior to the 12th century?
Which city was captured by the Ottoman Turks, resulting in the fleeing of scholars to Western Europe?
What kind of texts did Byzantine scholars take with them when they fled Constantinople?
An interest in texts from which two modern civilizations sparked the Italian Renaissance?
Which conflicts brought Europeans into contact with Arabs prior to the 11th century?
Which city was captured by the Ottoman Turks, resulting in the fleeing of scholars to Eastern Europe?
What kind of texts didn't Byzantine scholars take with them when they fled Constantinople?

context: Despite these crises, the 14th century was also a time of great progress in the arts and sciences. Following a renewed interest in ancient <a0_0><b5_0>Greek and Roman<b5_0/><a0_0/> texts that took root in the High Middle Ages, the Italian Renaissance began. The absorption of Latin texts had started before the Renaissance of the 12th century through contact with Arabs during <a1_0><b6_0>the Crusades<b6_0/><a1_0/>, but the availability of important <a4_0><b9_0>Greek<b9_0/><a4_0/> texts accelerated with the capture of <a2_0><b7_0>Constantinople<b7_0/><a2_0/> by the <a3_0><b8_0>Ottoman Turks<b8_0/><a3_0/>, when many Byzantine scholars had to seek refuge in the West, particularly Italy.
